comments.body: Sequoia is not purple.
I propose that this Azalea wood type be green.
Yes, but green is so unrealistic. Azalea is actually rather mildly light tan. Probably would have a more pinkish tint for MC.
I love this idea. There is no word ‚Äútoo much‚Äù for the wood types in our favourite game!
yeah there is no good reason why azalea trees have oak wood because they need to be bone mealed to grow so nobody uses them to get oak wood. this would actually make azeleas useful
Such an underrated idea
This feels very doable. at this point it's a simple reskin of the cherry blossom biome

DO IT

The end is BORING PLEASE RESTORE IT
If I could I will vote 999999999
Mojang, you HAVE TO CHANGE the end! Please!
Please!!! C¬¥mon Do it!!!

Exactly! 

Do you feel like there isn't enough "big" land masses anymore? Like I remember on the old system I could walk through a plains/meadow area for a long time and not run into a massive cliff/ravine/cave and wouldn't run into massive oceans and rivers all the time. 

Like now I feel like every land biome is extremely small due to the mass amounts of oceans and rivers everywhere, it doesn't feel like you can ever go inland and get away from the water anymore and it just feels like no matter where you go you're basically on an island. 

Also, I like the cliffs and caves, but I think there is WAY too many of them generating. Yesterday I explored a few new seeds trying to find a massive, relatively flat plains/meadows/forest biome without too much water around it and without a massive mountain around it and I finally found a "decent" area that fit that description (even though the plains/meadows area was only about 100 x 250 blocks) and as soon as I get to the center what do I see?... A massive crack in the ground that drops into nowhere and is as wide as the entire land mass I wanted to build on. 

I just think they should make them less common because it's impossible to find a good, flat, massive biome anymore. It sucks...

Yeah I agree. The new terrain looks kinda lumpy and ugly. Not to mention the massive caves. There is a datapack by Rainbeau called realistic caves which fixes the problem of caves tearing apart the land, and it is amazing. However, I have yet to find a mod/datapack which reverts terrain back to 1.7 - 1.17. I honestly have no idea why Mojang felt like they needed to change the terrain so much. The Minecraft world doesn't feel like home anymore, it feels like an alien planet now.

My biggest issue with the newest generation is that there is no good place to build. Before i could just place my house anywhere but now i have to dig out a flat plane to build my house. I would love an option to get the old generation with the new stuff without using mods (Aka i wanna do this on bedrock too)
Why are there only 6 votes on this!?!?
We need more votes!!!!!!!

Yeah, I Agree!

Mojang Could Literally Add Anything At All To The End. Even A Tiny Itty Bitty Little Particle Effect Could Do It Some Justice. Instead, Mojang Updates The Overworld For The Bajilionth Time. WHY HAVE THEY BEEN IGNORING THE END?!?!??
14 votes. THIS NEED 14000
They should also add birds. Also, the log cabins should maybe be a taiga thing.
Bigger trees...how am I supposed to build a tree house with oaks this small?
I second the bigger trees idea. One of the biggest reasons players don't rude horses around us because the forests are too low down.
Yes, this is a great idea. It would definitely give to the swamp atmosphere.

What if instead of armor, it was an augment to existing armor (I'm talking about leather armor) in the smithing table, creating a camo suit that would keep mobs from noticing you if you are sneaking or swimming in vegetation (such as tall grass/flowers, algae, kelp, sea grass, etc.)

Armadillos could be added. They eat anything smaller than them and live in large burrows that they sometimes share. When bred, four would always be a result, as in real life there are always four born (At least in nine-banded armadillos. They could spawn in plains and jungles, too.
yes please üò≠

Estaria genial. Pero yo creo que antes de eso vendria genial ( y necesitamos) una "render update" o algo asi.

En resumen, una actualizacion que, entre otras cosas, permita que que el juego renderize una mucho mayor cantidad de entidades.
Punto justo. Definitivamente eso tendr√≠a sentido. Son muchas entidades para renderizar, considerando todas las cosas.
I like this idea
I too have always wanted yetis that drop wool! Great idea.
I've been dying for some beautiful fall-color maples, and pink blossoms!
Que buen asa√±a
I really like the idea of having more biomes in the End. It should also be the only source of water in the End.
Maybe the water can be a pale purple, that bubbles, and it can be called acid.  Standing in it will deal damage as well as put the nausea buff

I like it, the only issue is they're adding the dripleaf plant, which is basically your lilly pads, and I cannot connect to the Ender Ooze page and as such have no idea what it is or what it does. Currently this biome really wouldn't be worth traveling to, when you could just go to end cities or ships instead. There needs to be some incentive to go here. Then again, your water, which I agree with the previous comment should be acid, would give you some interesting things to play with, and might give people incentive to come if it is exclusive to this biome
It looks beautiful. But I thought the vines would come from the trees themselves, not from the ceiling.

The thing is, all the trees would have their nether wart ‚Äúleaves‚Äù removed, so there wouldn‚Äôt be much space to have the vines hanging from the trees, and I personally prefer the look of it when the vines hang from the ceiling.
This would look awesome, especially if the trunks stretched to the roof of the nether.
love this! the portal structure in the blight field could act as a way to learn about the nether without having to use the internet

I think another end update would be cool maybe the traders could sell shulker boxes making them renewable also maybe end illagers with some sort of wingless ender dragon maybe they could be some sort of cult? Also it would be cool if they made some nice looking end plants as chorus fruits are really ugly.
The End has ships, so it should have docks and lighthouses

I really like your idea, especially the End Lighthouse !

I think it should be some kind of dungeon (probably made out of obsidian), hard to climb and containing jumping elements like a broken stair. The treasure would be the new interesting light source at the top. Someone already created such a block: it‚Äôs the Illumino, that can light up a large area. (I personally proposed the very similar End Sun that you can see on this comment, and there is another similar idea here.) Alternatively, it could be another new special light source, like a spotlight or a floodlight (see the corresponding posts), in that case it would be great if the rays could be visible and not just the light spot, in order to see that it‚Äôs a lighthouse. It could also be a horizontal beacon like described here.
I think it'd be better if it was generated half-destroyed, and contained some loot related to the Elytra. That way, it sort of has a story explanation on why ships never move.
Now Withers have a home!

Not very many.  It would be the only way to get spawn eggs in survival.
I don't think spawn eggs should spawn inside, but I like the idea of a ruin. Maybe with new items as loot?

Magma leches can travel with players through the nether portal to the overworld by sticking to them. Everything they touch burns. You can only kill leches with water. 

Ghast larva dwell in lava pools and attack players on boats. They also leech on to the boots, slow it down and pull it down.
